For any vaccine given, Fill in the Date Given, Batch Number, Place Given and Date of Next Visit
Advise mother on when to return for care immediately per table below:
Advise caregiver/ mother on when to return for the next set of immunizations due.
Give 1st dose of Rotavirus at 6 weeks or latest by 15 weeks; Give the 2nd dose of Rotavirus at 10 weeks or latest by 24 weeks of age.
Infants should not be vaccinated if a previous vaccination was followed by anaphylaxis, encephalitis or non-febrile convulsions
Yellow fever vaccine should not be given if there is history of anaphylaxis with ingestion of egg
Rotavirus vaccine should not be given: if child has a history of abdominal surgery, history of uncorrected congenital malformation of the gastrointestinal tract & a history of intussusceptions
Individuals with symptomatic HIV infection should not receive BCG Yellow Fever & Pneumococcal vaccines.
BCG vaccine can be given at birth since the HIV infected newborn is asymptomatic.
Measles vaccine should be given to HIV positive patients even though it is a live vaccine because the benefit outweighs the risk.
